{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3714127,"name":"Murilo Miranda Santos","username":"murilo404","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/49beb7/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-08-14T17:10:56.522Z","cooked":"

Good morning everyone! My FRC team recently switched from timedRobot to CommandRobot for programming. However, we’re having a problem where there’s a delay of approximately half a second when switching from one command to another. Currently, we use SequentialCommandGroup to perform sequential movements, and this is the method where the delay occurs. Does anyone know what it could be? If so, please leave a comment below. Thank you in advance for your response and help! Sorry for my English, I’m Brazilian.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2025-08-14T17:10:56.522Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":11,"reads":92,"readers_count":91,"score":73.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":505289,"topic_slug":"delay-when-run-command","display_username":"Murilo Miranda Santos","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":69705,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/delay-when-run-command/505289/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3714131,"name":"Brad","username":"Bmongar","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bmongar/{size}/228654_2.png","created_at":"2025-08-14T17:21:21.757Z","cooked":"

Links to your code and upload of your driver station logs can help.

Look for loop overrun errors in the driver station logs. These can show you where you have long executing methods.

The other thing to note is what are the end conditions of your commands. In a sequential command group each command must end before the next one starts. If you have some until you reach a setpoint logic in a command you may think you hit the setpoint but if you don’t have a tolerance around the value being examined it may look like you are there but you haven’t reached the full end of the command.

Just to be clear are you seeing a roughly 1/2 second delay in auto between your path and L4 command or are you seeing a 1/2 second delay between pressing a button and L4 or both?

I am guessing auto since that is the only sequential group I see,

I would guess that the path command isn’t finished when you think it is.

You can test to see if the L4 command is slow to start with just the button.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2025-08-14T18:02:03.912Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":73,"readers_count":72,"score":14.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":505289,"topic_slug":"delay-when-run-command","display_username":"Brad","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":38557,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"5126 Codenator / Electrical, CSA, FTAA, Inspector "},"post_url":"/t/delay-when-run-command/505289/4","custom_user_title":"5126 Codenator / Electrical, CSA, FTAA, Inspector ","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3714248,"name":"joel truher","username":"truher","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/truher/{size}/172222_2.png","created_at":"2025-08-14T19:59:50.711Z","cooked":"

I’d suggest using NetworkTables to log some of the interesting quantities, e.g. the observed setpoint, position, and output, for each mechanism. For this purpose, you could use AdvantageScope or Glass to make time-series plots. This sort of data-oriented troubleshooting is a key skill in robotics, especially as your systems become more complex and faster, and your control tolerances become tighter.
